description: Coined around 1900, either from hetero- (“different”) +‎ -onym (“name”) or from Ancient Greek ἑτερώνυμος (heterṓnumos), or perhaps both.

entries.meaning: (linguistics) A word having the same spelling as another, but a different pronunciation and meaning.
examples: Agape, "astonished" or "wide open," is a heteronym of agape, "Christian love."

entries.meaning: (literature) A fictitious character created by an author for the purpose of writing in a different style.
